Throughout the book there would be times when the excitement would die down and would not be as interesting as it was only a few pages before.  These were few and seemed somewhat far between.  It was worth it however, to keep reading.  The excitement always came back as good or better than it was before.  The excitement lasted throughout the whole book.  It was an interesting book that I would read again and enjoy just as much as the first time that I read it.

Jrassic Park is a very good book. One of Michael Crichton's best works. This book has a loy of excitment, action, and mystery. The attacks start and Jonh Hammond [the guy who made th park] is trying to cover them up but  then he can't anymore because people are finding out. He needs people to  come down to the park to give their personal thoughts about it. Donald  Gennaro the lawyer comes down to see it. Alan Grant, Ellie Sattler, and Ian  Malcome comes down to the island. I would recondmend this book to someone  who likes excitement and action.

This book is totally different than the movie but definately much better.  The prolouge is pretty boring and kind of strange and unrelated to the novel but the rest of it is really good.  The very beginning scene on the  island(the same as the beginning of the Lost World movie) makes the reader  want to keep on reading.  In the middle, I could not but this book down and  basically wanted to finish the other 200 pages that night.  I highly  recommended this book to any one.  Anyone that reads this book definately  should read the Lost World.

This is a terrific What-if work of fiction.  Unfortunately some others like thedoops and MissRaptor listed in the beginning simply miss the point.  This is a work of fiction, not something you sit around the table at the library discussing like a doctoral thesis.  The premise about the dinosaurs is just that... since no one really knows what the dinosaurs were like or how they acted I found the premise to be very entertaining.  If you want true entertainment, read this book.  If you want to impress each other, look to the campus archives.

This book has one of the most original plots ever! There is no nuclear terrorists, no space invasions, nothing like that. This plot is actually original! I loved it! The action scenes are great. The characters are as real as you and me, and it is stuffed with suspense to the point of bursting! Even if you already saw the movie, read Jurassic Park! It is different enough that you won't guess everything before it happens. The ending is COMPLETELY different. The opening chapters with the dinosaur attacks hooked me! READ THIS NOW!

I picked JP from a used book pile, I had never seen any of the JP movies or read anything by Michael Crichton. The premise is great.  Modern day dino's terrorizing a remote island. The book was half exciting, half a challenge to get through.  I wasn't buying all of it sometimes which made it hard to read, and the technical stuff got to be too much (a complaint I've read in other reviews of Crichton works). All in all mixed feelings about this one.

I found Jurassic Park to be a very interesting book, and alsovery entertaining.  The reason I liked Jurassic Park so much wasbecause Michal Crichton studied the top scientific frontiers of the time and made them the subject for his book.  This also makes the aside from entertaining, also educational.  Even though the book was great it's movie was not aas good.  It did have better special effects than the book but all and all the book was better.  Well Jurassic Park is an entertaining book to read, and I suggest you do so.

Do you like dinosaurs lots of action and most of all Michael Chrichton? If you do pick up this book. Five million people own this book and you should be one of them. But there is only one drawback. DNA and genetics are talked  about a lot in this book which makes it slow at times. This is not a bad  book at all if you can handle those times. You can also read it over again  and it doesn't get boring. Though it is good I would take the movie over  the book anyday though.Peace out my homeboyz! West Coast is the Best C!oast

I have always been drawn to science and fiction, and thus one of my most favorite books are almost always science fiction. This is a stunning example of the Genre. Scientific fact, a dash fantasy, and a lot of realism and you have a book like "Jurassic Park". The way Michael Crichton writes in a reporting, nonbiased way that acually propell the book further into your mind, because of the fact that this is acually possible. In short this book is wounderfully ambisious and accurate. A wounderful book indeed.

I'm still in love with this book. I had to read it a second and third time. Michael Crichton just has a magical way of blending science with real world action to make it believable. I've always liked his writing style, and Jurassic Park is most certainly a deserved classic work of Crichton's. From the first scene dealing with a strange "accident" with one of the workers, to the final escape and deaths of characters that seem almost too important and big to die, this is story that simply deserves to be read.

I read this book at the age of 12, about two years after it was first published and about a year before it became mainstream. Crichton's impecable tact for detail and action made this quite possibly the best book  I have ever read. It is very fast paced (I read it in 1 and 1/2 days, yeah  I was 12 too) and VERY hard to put down. The charecters, especially Ian  Malcolm, were incredibly designed and MADE the book. Crichton has put out  his best book ever, even beating Andromeda Strain. I HIGHLY recomend  reading it.

This is the book that got me in to reading best sellers. Well written and defined, it also describes the dangers of cloning. There is hardly a flaw in this book, and its not only about dinosaurs. It more about selfish  ambitions, and the people behind them (John Hammond), their disregard for  everything arround them etc It also brilliantly describes the  phrase"Nature always find a way". The filmed version also merited  5 stars but if  have to compare between the two, its the book which wins on  points.

I have never actually seen the movie, but the book was a wonderful, riveting adventure/sci-fi maybe even semi-horror story with wonderful charcter devolpment and a sense of ... realness.  After reading this book,  you feel like anything is possible.  I was on the verge of asking someone  if the events in this book really happened.  That's how believable it is.  All in all, this was a wonderful book everyone should at least try.  I wish  Amazon could let you give stories more than 5 stars.  This deserves 10.

I read this one in one sitting.  God, what a tense little story!  I loved the movie too, but the book was by far better.  A thriller and a science lesson all in one!  How cool.  Malcolm has such a dramatic death scene at the end of this one, how could Mr. Crichton ruin it by bringing him back for the Lost World?  Ian's death was the perfect "I told you so" for Hammond, and as much as I liked the smart-mouthed egomaniac, there was no need for his return in a sequel.  Jurassic Park stands on its own.

This book was the first novel that I ever read, and it totally got me into the reading business. This book was great. Michael Crichton works wonders with a pen and some paper. This book I enjoyed most over some of the other  books I've read since, in fact, I read it twice. I loved the plot, and it  is not all too far fetched, and the story just flow together, which made it  quick reading. This book was far better than the movie, but the movie was  pretty good, and I recomend it to anyone who enjoys to read.

The book is simply amazing. It is a thriller that had me wondering what would happen next at the end of each page. If you enjoyed the movies, then you'll love this. The movies were created using parts from book 1 and book 2, so there will be some parts you recognize and don't. The book has a lot to offer and is a great read for everyone. Crichton gets very scientific and uses many academic words throughout the whole book. I personally love how he incorporated it within the book, but be warn when reading.

This is the first Crichton novel I read.  After seeing the movie, that I loved, I ran to the store to get the book. Not only was the book very different from the movie, but ten times better.  It is written beautifully by MC.  This guy has one hell of an imagination that makes you feel like you are the one running from the T-Rex, screaming not to be eaten by rapters, and gasping at the huge brontosaurs.  If you enjoyed the movie, take the time to pick up this book.  It is increadible.  5 stars.

Jurassic Park by Michael Crichton leaves you hanging in every chapter. I was sitting on the edge of my seat the entire time just waiting for the next heart-stopping moment to take place. I've seen the first two movies before I came across this book, and let me tell you: the book is MUCH better. When I read the first chapter I was instantly hooked and believe that everyone will truely enjoy this book. With twist and turns at every corner this will sure to be the favorite of all Crichton novels.

This book is far better than the movie! I actually watched the movie first as a pre-teen and would wake up with nightmares about the dinosaurs I so dearly loved as a little child. The book at some parts had me holding my breath or frantically flipping through pages on my Kindle. At some parts of the book I was left wondering, "Why did they cut this out of the movie? This would have added more context!" Again, I have to iterate that this was a beautiful piece of suspenseful fiction!

This was a GREAT book--thrilling, interesting, and with such detail that you really felt like you were there.  The only reason I took off a star is because this particular version (mass market paperback) was so full of typos that it was somewhat distracting.  It was almost comical how many typos there were in this book, there were probably more than any other book I've read.  It was still a great price for a riveting book, I just probably would not order this version/this publisher again.

Jurassic Park is the best and the most thrilling novel I've ever read, and believe me, Crichton keeps you at the edge of your seat till the very end. The story is great and the dinos, convincingly terrifying. My favourite  part is when Tim and Lex try to outwit the Raptors, by trying to shut them  in the cold-storage, and by mistake, Tim shuts the cold-storage door on the  Raptor's tail. Believe me, this part is especially thrilling! Crichton's  best work to date. Keep up the superb work!

Micheal Crichton's Jurassic Park is astonishing, to say the least. The book takes you into a vast bio-reconstructed, 65 million year old island. I think that the book is obviously more in-depth than the movie. It is a one-two day read with so much page-turning elements. Micheal Crichton is very talented at creating awesome-like mental pictures with this book. Some of his other great books include: State of Fear, Timeline, and of course Congo. I strongly believe this is a must own book.

I like the book, but the hard cover edition leaves much to be desired.  It is reminiscent of what one might find in an elementary school library.  It is smaller than standard hard cover editions of books and the type goes so far into the center binding that often one has to exert too much pressure on the binding to read these words.  Though the price may be tempting I would not recommend this hardcover edition.

This is the best book I have ever read in my entire life.  It is fabulous.  I couldn't stop reading this book, it was terrific, filled with action, drama and suspense.  This is a must-read for any, dinosaur fan, action  lover, or just somebody who wants to read a great book.  The original novel  is a lot better than the movie.  It's jam packed with more veloci-raptor  chases, Tyranosaurus attacks, and dinosaurs that weren't even in the movie.  This is truly a wonderful, wonderful book!

I read this book a few years back, after I saw the movie, and really enjoyed it. Of course the text is too complicated for the average  viewing audience, I had trouble following the book. Yes, I'm used to an easy read, but this one had me thinking just to follow the story. If you put forth the effort it's well worth it. The book is ten times the story the movie is. Do yourself a favor if you like the movie, or any of Crichton's movies, and read the book. Then pat yourself on the back.

I really enjoyed this novel. As a huge fan of the movie franchise, I can't believe it took so many years to read this. I'm glad I did! I actually enjoyed this more than the movie. Character development and back k story are my favorite, so to see the depth that Crichton gives to some of my favorite characters was great! I also like that the movie adaptation had a life of it's own, and wasn't exactly the same as the book. I highly suggest this read to anyone who is a fan of the movies!

I read this after watching the movie. Granted, it was about 70% picturesque for reading. Right down to the theme music playing in my head the entire time I read it. However, as with most movies, there was more to the book, much more. I would even go as far as saying that in the Jurassic Park movie sequels they used scenes later described in this particular novel. Either way, Crichton is a master storyteller and I thoroughly enjoyed this original telling of the Jurasic Park story.

Jurassic Park was one of most interesting, and fantastic novels that I ever read. The reason that I started to read this book was because I liked to read about dinosaurs. I knew it would be good story, but I never thought  that it would be great! One of the parts that I liked was when dinosaurs  started to get out and cause the damage in Jurassic Park. It was described  very well(especially T-rex) and it gave chills. I really recommand this  book to everyone that reads my review.

Hail to Michael Crichton!  Jurassic Park is yet another stunning piece of work from Crichton that causes voluntary insomnia -- you just won't sleep until you've finished reading it.  And I'm sure that wasn't just a figure  of speech to many readers. I've read many, many science fictions, but none  came even close to Crichton's works.  P.s.  The movie version may has  amazing FXs, but it has skipped essentially all the good parts of the book.  Read it, and you'll agree with me.

In Fourth grade I watched the movie and I dicided I had to read the book,  three years later I finally did.  This is a great book, my personal  favorite of M.C.'s, and it is certainly much deeper and twisted than the  movie.  There are idea's that just sends chills down your spine in the book  that they don't even scratch the surface of in the movie.  I must read for  Crichton fans.  I would recomend the movie as an alternative for younger  kids, the book is a more graphic.-Eli@

Michael Crichton is, arguably, the inventor of modern suspense.  Instead of subjecting us to the rather tepid mystery this book could have been, he lets us writhe in delightful agony as we watch the characters slowly realize their dino-dinner potential.  Two of the story's downfalls are the character development (mediocre) and the plot (doesn't live up to what it's trying to be).  A fun, light hearted romp at best, but still worth the hour and a half it'll take you to read it.
Came in like new condition. Very pleased it made a perfect gift!
I have read this book many times over the years.  Still love it.

I think this book is a pretty good book but it takes awhile for the reader to get into the book and really enjoy it. Once you get into Jurassic Park you will be on the edge of your seat until the very end. The dinosaurs seam so real that you will think that you are in the book.I would highly recomend this book to a reader who would be patient enough to get to the best of the book and then they would love it. Jurassic Park is a very good book and I suggest that you read it.

Once again,I have found a book that is by far,better than the movies. This happens to be one of my favorite books! The setting is based on an island where a crazy scientist who's too rich for his own good,creates dinosaurs using D.N.A from the blood of fossilized mosquitoes. I won't tell you the rest. Yet,I will warn you,this book is nothing like the movie! It's extremely gory and there is alot of foul language. I'd suggest it for mature readers only. YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!

This book was about a man who wanted a to build a park...Jurassic Park.  A rich seventy year old man named John Hammond wanted to build a childs theme park with none other than dinosaurs.  The main character is a paloetologist named Alan Grant. The book takes place on an island 100 miles off the coast of Costa Rica.  The island turns bad when a storm hits the island knocking down power, and the electric fences.  I thought the story was really good, and I really liked it.

I absolutely loved this book! I read it in two days. It had tons of action and it also had an intellectual part to it that the movie did not have. The beginning of it was really great and i learned a little about costa rica.  There were also many other things that happened in the book that never  happened in the movie.The ending was also different too. Ian Malcom's quips  and witty remark's were very entertaining and humorous. the book is 10  times better than the movie.

I absolutely love this book, one my all time favourites under its sequel the Lost World. It only received a three star rating because I have discovered a serious amount of typos, especially towards the end of the novel. I am not sure if it just my copy plagued by these misplaced letters, but it was annoying to say the least. Despite this, it is an excellent read and if you enjoyed the movie, I highly recommend the book, it will give you a new perspective of the series!

I bought this book when it first came out aabout a decade ago. Since then it has become my favorite book of all time. I have read it 152 times to date and am currently rereading it to get hyped up for JP3. If you liked the movie, you'll love the book. It's 100 times more detailed, 100 times more intense, and has so much more to offer than the movie. If for no other reason, read it to ssay you have. Join the rest of the world. Even my 80 year old gramma has read it LOL

Michael Crichton's staggering talent never shines more brilliantly than in this novel.  If you liked the film, you'll love the novel.  If you shy away from blockbusters and surrounding hype, don't do yourself the disservice of writing this book off as pulp.  It is a startlingly educational, high-suspense novel that wraps a fantastic crisis in a strong (if obvious) moral message.  This is unquestionably in the top ten of the thousand or so books I have read.  Enjoy!

The movie Jurassic Park was and still is one of my fav. movies. And this book is somewhere on the top book list. It's actually pretty different in some ways than the movie. But that's good, as it'll make you want to keep on reading until 2 am. It's a great book. All the adventure you can take! It also has more dinos and describes all that genetic stuff, than in the movie. But this is not a book this is an adventure! Crichton makes you feel like you're in the book!

Read the book. Watch the movie.  The book has so much more going on.  The perspective is different than the movie (different hero). More animals. More dangerous situations. The book is packed with action. I couldn't put it down.  I even read it again just because I enjoyed the experience.  I'll probably read it a third time now that some time has passed.  It takes longer to read the book than sit down and watch the movie, but reading this book is very satisfying.

Growing up one of my favorite movies was Jurassic Park. I'd consider myself an avid sci-fi reader and this book blew me away. It went far beyond my expectations from what I remember of the movie as a kid - it's so much more and not doesn't end in a typical hollywood 'happy ending'. The short chapters make it nearly impossible to put the book down. As an engineer, I really enjoy the science Michael Crichton includes - there's just the right amount and they're not unfathomable.

Jurassic Park is an edge-of-your-seat thriller. Your senses are always alert during this story. It keeps you wanting to read more. The details in this story are spectacular! You can picture that you are in the story.This  book makes you wonder if someday, in the future, people could genetically  engineer dinosaurs. The author really described the flesh wounds greatly.  It is so descriptive it makes you queasy. It makes you think that this  could really happen.

This book is the best sci-fi novel ever written. Michael Crichton has combined dinosaur and man in a very powerful form of writing. The book draws you in, and it's extremely hard to put it down. Reading it once is  not enough, you have to read it over and over to get its full meaning. It  would be hard to believe that some who loves dinosaurs hasn't read it at  least once. I would recommend this book to anyone who is interested to  high-tech sci-fi adventure.

This book is great. Chrighton describes the dinosaurs, and elements for a great visual picture. The raptors supply a climax that has you scared of getting your stomach sliced open. In the back of your mind, you never  forget about the  T-Rex.  As Tim, Allen, and Lex venture through the  Island, you get the whole layout.  Theres plent acton  and suspense for  most of the book. When theres not action, there's interesting information.  The sequel is also great.

The novel of Jurassic Park is much different from the movie but still entertaining. There are actually more dinosaurs involved in the story line of the novel than there are in the film. The action scenes are great, the dinosaurs are awesome and the characters are likable. And even though the story is long and filled with scientific details that I cannot begin to understand, the chapters are short and it doesn't bore you to death with unnecessary material.

This book is THE best book I've ever read.  I've seen the movie and read the book twice, and the book is even better than the movie.  Michael Crichton does tons of research before he writes his book, and in Jurassic  Park it shows.  The action and suspense keeps you on the edge of your seat  even if you know what happens.  You could read it 10 times and still not  get tired of it.  If you like Michael Crichton or action in general, this  book is for you.

This book takes off, it is a wonderful fact based fairy tale of sorts.  It doesn't even compare to the movie in a good way and I liked the movie.  There is so much more to this book, no wonder the original Jurassic Park movie was said to be five hours long.  The one scene I really remember not being in the movie, was when the T-Rex chases them down the river when they are in a boat.  This is just another one of those books that everyone should pick up.

IN THE HISTORY OF THE UNIVERSE!!!!!!  I have read this book, like, four times, and I could never ever ever ever get tired of it!  The characters are vivid, the explanations make you feel like it is real, and you feel like you are THERE!  Every time you think things can not possibly get any worse than they are, MC just twists the story further! Nothing can be said to match the sheer majesty of this book!!  How about a third installment in the JP series?

As usual Michael Crichton executes a brilliant set-up and brings in all the characters for introduction by the end of the second itieration.  The bulk of the book is a rollercoaster ride and the suspense is heightened by periodically killing off his characters.  Crichton doesn't end his books well, wrap up is not his forte.  Interesting to see the changes they made to the movie, which would have definitely spruced up the characterisation in the book.

I know, I know... everybody already loves this book. But it's worth mentioning that the book, unlike the movie, has a rising suspense that I've never seen equaled anywhere else. Reading this book makes you TENSE, and not because Crichton hides the ball; you can see where everything's going, and somehow that makes it even more exciting. This is one of the few thrillers that you can read more than once and not be horribly bored the second time around.

I've read both Jurassic Park and The Lost World, but Jurassic Park was  definately better.  It was exciting, yet chilling.  Mysterious, yet funny.  It is probably the best book I've ever read.  Micheal Crichton is a genius  when it comes to being an author.  The book was a lot better than the movie  and more detailed.  Definately considered a science book.  Dinosaur lovers,  science lovers, and sci-fi lovers, read Micheal Crichton's, Jurassic Park!

Almost everyone's heard of the movie, Jurassic Park.  If you haven't, then you've probably been in a coma for the last four years.  You probably think, since you've seen the movie, you don't need to read the book.  WRONG!  The book is totally different from the movie.  This is a book you literally don't want to read while it's dark.  The details will make you think, shudder, and then take a glance just to make sure there's not a dinosaur in the room

I loved this book.  I would love to be able to own an unabridged audio version as my commute allows me plenty of time to listen, not much time to read.  It would be great if Random House could do a full unabridged version of the book.  It would be worth it.  I know some people like abridged versions due to lack of time, but I don't want someone else deciding what's "good" or "important" plus I have no lack of time whatsoever.  Please consider this.

Jurassic Park is definietly one of the best books I have ever read.  I am 13 and in the eighth grade.  I read JP over the summer for an advanced reading program.  I didn't think that I would like it, since most school-assigned books are terrible, and the teachers constantly  "kill" the semi-good books.  Surprisingly, I loved it!  I  definitely recommend this book to anyone who likes dinosaurs, biological  engineering, or science fiction.

Micheal Crichton has astounded me again.I have already read "The Lost World",and I have very highly anticipated "Sphere".I liked Jurassic Park much better than The Lost World because the Lost World didn't have much on bio-engineering.The success of the movies may tempt you,but I suggest reading the book first.And i'll tell you this,when you start one of Micheal Crichton's books,you'll be lost in your world of imagination.

Back when I was in 5th grade I saw the previews for the film of this book so I went out and read it. It was huge and yet I sat up every night till about 3 every morning and the next thing I knew I was done in a week. The  book is amazing and as much as I liked the movie it really couldnt compare  with this book. BUY THIS BOOK NOW!  It is a real thriller and will have  you up at night flipping through the pages. You cant put this book down.

Exactly what you'd expect from Crichton.  If this statement connotes good experiences, then read this book.  If not, you'll probably not enjoy it all that much.  Perhaps I'm not a pompous med student who wants to point out  all the scientific flaws with this book, but hey -- are we really going to  read "Jurassic Park" for research purposes?  If you're looking  for an exciting read, "Jurassic Park" is well worth it.

Anyone who enjoys books filled with suspense, and has had some past aspirations for working with large, unpredictable animals should definitely read this book.  It opens up a world of twisted imagination and offers the  reader vivid characters who provide witty and often meaningful dialogue.  For those who desire a quick fix of fear, yet also yearn for the powerful  characteristics of a masterpiece, Jurassic Park is the book for you.

Wow.  From the Prolague to the Epilogue, you won't have a dull moment!  Crichton blends science with plot in his usual incredible style-it's hard to believe you're learning something as you read.  There comes this point in the book where you just can't stop...and you finally take a break and realize you just read 100 pages in what seemed like 20 minutes!  As soon as you find out one answer, another mystery comes by to challenge you...
I loved it. Very different from the movie but still great.

Though the movie was great, the book puts the film to shame.  I could not  put it down.  It contains twice as much material as the Jurassic Park  movie.  Many of the best parts were NOT in the film (such as when the  doctor and the children were on a river raft being chased by the T. Rex  that was swimming after them or when they went to the aviry and were  attacked by pterodactyls.)  Don't buy the VCR tape or DVD, buy the book!!!

Probably the best dinosaur book ever, and thats because the dinosaurs are practically irrelevant.  This is a novel that depicts man's incompetence and arrogance on the grandest scale.  Enjoy the science behind the creation, and the politics behind the deceit.  Sit back and just as you begin to relax remember that the animals in the zoo are 30 feet high and weigh over 8 tonnes; still calm, have you no self-preservation instincts?

Do not think that because you saw the movie you don't need to read the book. The book is better. it has a lot of action and suspense. It is quite long but worth reading. The basic plot is that there is a lot of people with very different backgrounds that are trapped on an island with a bunch of geneticly engineered dinosaurs that want to hurt them. And to top it off the power is out. If you like Sci-Fi thrillers read this book.

This is a great book, about scientist's finding a way to recreate  dinosaurs, then gone wrong.  This book has comedy, suspense, action, and  drama.  Crichton has a wonderful cast of characters, some colorful, some  sarcastic and funny.  He has great description and has obviously done his  research.  Crichton keeps you guessing, never knowing who's going to die or  what will happen next.  This is a must read book, buy it today!

This book has to be the best I have ever read!  Michael Chrichton is a genius when it comes to science fiction.  This book filled my excitement,  adventure and great characters.  Every character is different but alike in  some way.  The beautiful volcanic island setting brings out the characters  innerself.  When the dinosaurs escape they have to get them back on the  cages.  You should read the book to find out what happens!

When the Jurassic Park movie came out back in 1993, my parents wouldn't permit me to see it until I read the book first.  As a 12-year-old kid on summer break that just wanted to see the movie with her friends, this was miserable! I devoured this book in an attempt to read it before all of my friends had seen it already in the theaters.  Looking back, however, the book was an amazing story and much better than the movie!!

Honestly, I wish there was a 12 on the chart.  If anybook in existence deserves a rating that high, this is theone.  Crichton is the master of what he does.  I've read all of his stuff, and Jurassic Park still gives me chills when I LOOK at it.  The movie was great, and I think did the book justice, but still, nothing can compare.  This book is a movie playing in your mind, and you can watch it as many times as you want.

If you have seen the movie but haven't read the book then you need to rethink your life position. This has everything the movie didn't have plus more. It makes the movie look like an episode of Barney. You will orgasm five times per chapter. Guaranteed.

There is only one way to say how i feel about this book: perfect. It has action, gore, and is just wonderful.  The movie doesn't do it justice. From the first page you get absorbed into your own little world of Jurrasic Park.  Not only is it wonderfully written but it has so many underlying morals. anyone who has eyes and can read has got to give this novel a look. Heck, i've read it about 10 times and it never gets old!

Very good book. I enjoyed reading it! If you like thrillers and dinosaurs, you don't wanna miss this one. Also, I want to make a note that this book and that movie "Jurassic Park" made back in 1993 is VERY DIFFERENT! So, don't judge the book by its movie. The book is a lot better! (In my opinion) The best part is the non-stop action and intense feeling you get that makes you wanna read on 'till the end. I loved it!

I saw the movie before I read the book and now I love both. The book added more dimensions than the movie did and there was a lot more conflict than just staying away from dinosaurs in the book. The characters were well developed and their different and often conflicting objectives made it interesting. The only warning is that it is rather grusome and bloody. Overall it was a terrific book and I highly reccomend it.

It is exciting and it keeps you on the edge of the book the whole time. This book is about a man named John Hammond who finds some dinosaur DNA. Then he uses that DNA to clone dinosaurs in an island close to Costa Rica, and he calls it Jurassic Park. Then Dr. Hammond invites a group of people to review his new amusement park when all of a sudden things go wrong. I really enjoyed this book because it was interesting.

One of the best books I had ever read. There is no comparison between the book and the movie because the book has the movie beat by way far. I first seen the movie and loved it. The book was so good that I was very  disapointed in the movie. Both has two different story lines. Even a couple  of the main characters died at the end who didn't die in the movie. If you  like Jurassik Park then you must read this book.

i loved this book. Michael Crichton is my Favorite author and i loved the movie but the book is so much better an to be honest a little bit different in good way though. anyone who said they didn't like the movie is just because they seen it five times. but let me tell you something it had more story it's longer and all around better then the movie not that the movie was bad it's just the book is better written

In this book it is a story about people that go to an island and encounter many things on the way.John Hammond is the owner-scientist at JP and then brings dinos back to life.He figures out the DNA and produces Dinosours. Many things go wrong Which puts the park in serious danger and they all try to help in any way they can. Beware the book is very different from the movie. The book is by Micheal Crichton. 1991

I may be only a high school student, but Michael Crichton is one of my favorite authors already, and this book was another one of his best.  The sci-fi thriller novel was a roller coaster ride of action, science, and it  also got deeply into the ethics problem that faces genetic engineering  today.  I thought it was an excellent book, and I highly recommend it to  anyone who likes reading good books as a hobby.

This book is honestley my favorite book of them all. I have always loved it and I read it over and over again. It has everything you need in a good book. I think the movie is even better. After you read this book, you will be so in to dinosaurs and Jurassic Park that you can't even believe it. I have always loved this book and the movie. After reading the book I now have the dream of becoming a Paleontologist.

This classic is as good as it gets in the book-fiction industry. A story about a man with a great idea about bringing dinosaurs back to life and making it a park attraction for all peoples of the world to enjoy, becomes  a disastrous suicide-like trip for a group of handpicked  "inspectors". The reader will undoubtedly be into this book  because of its great and almost life-like realism. A must get.

After a reading this old sci-fi tome that contributed to many obsessive months of fanboyism many years ago when the movie came out, I realised this is as good a book as ever. While the technologies have come a long way since then, the message of not playing God and messing with nature the way it was intended still rings true. Crichton was and probably still is a genius at combining science fact and fiction.

Jurassic Park is one of the better sci-fi books from a notable sci-fi author.  It has deep roots in dinosaurs and exo-laboratory adventure.  The technological devices and theoretical plots synthesizes prize in this bestselling novel.  There are points when you feel velociraptors breathing down your neck and smell dew on leaves of deadly plants.  Yellow frogs are the last thing you will be worrying about.

The true wonders of reading...makes one thankful for the wider horizon the silverscreen could not provide. Book is definitely better and more exciting than the movie version. Reader is literally brought to 'the jungle out there' with the many dinosaurs not seen in the film. Exciting and heart pounding in itself. Thanks, Spielberg for the adaptation but hats off to Crichton, the true genius behind it all

Brilliant, fast, a whole lot of fun.  Crushes the movie.  Just finished another book I also LOVED: NATURAL SELECTION by Dave Freedman, all about the evolution of a new species of flying predator!  Like Jurassic, it was absolutely riveting, a fantastic mix of real science and fast-moving fiction.  Impossible to put down too, literally skipped work to finish it, cover to cover in a day and a half.

I was 10 when I first read this book and now Im 13 Ive read it at least 4 times since then and the lost world twice. I enjoyed the perspective of the author as well as the snazzy dialoge. I enjoyed books light touches of humor. An overall sense of intelligence. All process and all destination at the same time. Brillant narrration to a simple story succesful at captivatng the imaginations of the world.

I was 10 when I first read this book and now Im 13 Ive read it at least 4 times since then and the lost world twice. I enjoyed the perspective of the author as well as the snazzy dialoge. I enjoyed books light touches of humor. An overall sense of intelligence. All process and all destination at the same time. Brillant narrration to a simple story succesful at captivatng the imaginations of the world.

This is a wonderful book. It combines science and adventure in such a great way that it led me to read a book about the "Chaos Theory" (not much to do with the book but very interesting). Believe me, you won't  be able to put it down for hours, don't be surprised if the sun comes up  while you are still reading. I've read it twice and I would read it again.  Enjoy it (I am sure you will).

This was a really good book! It mantained a high level of action throughout the whole book and it was very describtive and interesting. The movie was great too, except for the ending. I thought it was very different from the book, and I personally thought the book's ending was much more realistic. I highly recommend that you read Michael Crichton's JURASSIC PARK if you're looking for a page turner!

This book, Jurassic Park, is one of Crichton's best books, if not  the best of them all. Basicaly a simple story, man creates dinosaur and then loses control of dinosaur. Runs in the same vein as Frankenstein. Anyways, a really good book, the first time  I read it, I finished it in a about a day and a half, I've read it four times since then, the story never gets old and is a thriller every time.

after seeing the movie, i read the book and realized that the book was a heck of a lot better.  the movie had the raptors being twenty times their origional size.  this is one of his best books that i have read and one of the best i have ever read.  crichton has sooooo many theries in this which have nothing to do with the origional story line but if u excuse those, than it is an excellent book.

I must have read this book about four times atleast.  In my opinion, it is better than the book. I never get tired reading it, no matter how many times I read it.  It may have its gory parts and bad language, but you can ignore that , and get to the good stuff.  Michael Crichton really makes the Characters come out and live.  I would recommend this book to amyone who likes adventure.  Its great!

Although Michael made some factual errors, the plot(a man who wants to make a dinousaour theme park invites soem people to come look at it, and the dinousaours break loose because their electric fences fail)and the characters(Dr. Ian Malcom and Grant are fascinating)make this the best sci-fi book ever. It competes-and defeats-War of the Worlds(H.G.Wells)and 2001, 2062, and 3001. a excellent boo

I read this book some years ago and thoroughly enjoyed it. I saw the movie first and then read the book. The Book was better in my opinion; although, I did enjoy the movie. As books should, it provoked me to ponder if such cloning experiments are happening on some remote island in some remote part of the world. Who knows but it is interesting and scary to think that it could be happening.

Not Crichton's best, but still excellent. Crichton tells a story of a park that features genticaly engineered dinosaurs.  The experts are called in for a preview, and so are the owner's grandkids. But soon, all hay breaks loose, and the guests must fight to survive on this island paradise.  The story is good, but not every thing adds up. Overall, this is a good book.

This is absolutley the best book of all time!!! Michael Crichton writes so great that it's impossible not to love it. The charecters are written so well and you can relate to all of them. Even the way the book is layed out iis just perfect. I recommend this book to anybody who likes science fiction or Michael Crichton books, or really just plain fiction. This book will appeal to everyone.

I teach American Lit and this is one of the novels we read.  It opens up all kinds of discussions on the morality of science.  Again, Michael Crichton doesn't write great characters, his strength was in his ability to relate a gripping adventure even though the characters are rather flat.  This book is so much better than the movie.  Do yourself a favor and read it, you won't be sorry.

My title says it all, doesn't it? This is an absolutely stunning book showing very thoughtful authoring. The movie doesn't compare. If you saw the movie and read the book, you'd know what I was talking about. The author displays his incredible word usage and story-telling ability in this masterpiece. Gets a bit gory at times, but overall a very good book. Buy it if you haven't already.

I could not put this book down!! I thought that it explained the plot and  problems of the characters in great detail. Also it really made you feel as  if you were there, since it had so many details. This book was way better  than THE LOST WORLD. I'm lucky that I read this one first because the other  book really turned me off. Overall I thought that this was one of  Crichton's best.

This is one of those books that makes you stop and say "WOW" when it's over. It is fast-paced, suspenseful, thrilling, and clever. I like all of the Michael Crichton books I have read but this one is really special. The plot is so brilliant that I wish I could say that I came up with this idea. Bottom line: READ THIS BOOK! I liked the movie as well but it doesn't do the book justice.

This is one of my absolute favorite books. It has suspense written all over it. I recomend it very highly to anyone who is up to Michael Crichton's writing. I think this book should come with popcorn and coke.  The first chapter will suck you into the story like a tornado. Read it, and  experience a story that will never be forgotten as one of the best suspense  stories ever written!

This is one of the best book that I have read. And the funny thing is that it is still good even when you read it more than once. I personally have read it 3 times. I have never read a book that often before, and I plan to read it another time soon. A pure masterpiece. Let's just hope that Crichton does not go the way of the movie and kills the series by writing a third installment.

I am twelve now, but I first read this book when I was 8 and I loved it!This is a story about a genetics experiment that kind of went bad. I liked the level of adventure and the way Michael described and detailed the the scenery and the characters were! I enjoyed The Lost World but that was a sequel to the movie, because if you remember, in the book Ian Malcom died from his wounds

The only thing that saved this book was that it has a cool premise - I mean, who wouldn't want to imagine being able to see a live dinosaur? But the writing is bad. The plot is full of deus ex machina and irritating sermons by professor Malcolm. This left me weighing for a rewrite by someone with more talent.

While the scientific anchor is dubious, it's real enough for science fiction.  Meanwhile check out the characters.  So wonderfully multi-dimensional (this is where the movie falls miles short)  My favorite  of which has to be Ian Malcom, so realistic and passionate, Crichton is  revealing an alter ego.  (also there's an artful point of entry in Gennaro)  Definately a must read.

I found this book shortly after the movie......so years ago......and it is one of those books that you can read over and over, and it just doesn't get old to me......I needed a kindle copy after wearing out my paperback copy, so I have now bought this book at least 3 times, those paperbacks just don't hold up well.....Love it, love everything that Michael Crichton has written.
Great read, however, spelling errors in the book?!

Proof that the novel is always better than the movie!  I've seen the movie and read the book multiple times each and the book is far more suspenseful and well thought out. Of course nothing beats the sight of the big T-Rex stomping into the scene with its earth-shaking roar. Crichton will always be a cut above when it comes to sci fi/suspense/action/drama.  A real classic.

What else can I say about this book except it is a classic. It is Crichton at his best. A well thought out book that turned into a classic movie as well. Its a shame that they changed so much in the movie version but it all works in the end. This is defiantly on my list of books to read before you die and if you are a fan of the movie read this now before i smack you!!!

This was the first Chrichton book that I read after seeing the movie and  it was much better!  Although some of the explanations were a little  boreing I still learned alot.  Great attention to detail and wonderfull  descriptions.  You won't be disapointed, nothing like the OK movie.  Characters were believable and the plot was intricate.  A extraordinary  Sci-Fi novel!

I love Crichton in general. But, this book is my favorite! The first 100 pages are alittle slow, alot of character development. But, after that it's great. I couldn't put it down, so I read it in 2 days. It's way better than the movie. And, if you've seen all 3 movies, you'll read some things in the book that are from all 3. Great book, I could read it again and again.
It's...Jurassic Park. Jurassic Park gets 5 stars.

Jurrasic Park is a good book. It's about some people who go to an island off the coast of Costa Rica. The island has dinosaurs on it that get loose. The people have to get off the island or die. The good thing about the book  is that it's unpredictable . The bad thing about it is that it prolongs the  suspense in parts in the story. Other than that it is a great book.

This is Crichton's best book yet!As soon as I picked up the book I could't put it down.If you liked Spielberg's movie, you will like the book.The book has the same storyline as the movie with a few added scenes and a bit more  character description.Chriton does a great job of combining reality with  fiction.If you have a lot of spare time on your hands buy the book!

I was fortunate enough to read the book two years after the movie came out. I found the book to be a page turner. The book differed from the movie which added to the excitement of reading the book. The ending to the book is the best part of the book because it differs from the movie. Regardless of what you thought of the movie, the book is a must read for everyone.

This was a splendid book! I read the book before I watched thewfilm, and I found the book better suited to my imagination, but thefilm was also very good. The way Crichton managed to captivate the reader from start to finish made this a truly excellent "un-put-downable" read! Also, the Lost World is much different to the film; another masterpiece, from the master.

The book is 1000 percent better than the movie. I was shocked where the movie came from. All I recognized were the characters. Events were out of order in the movie I'm not  sorry I saw the movie itledme to the book nut while the book was a apage turner and I  wanted to read it I wish I had read the book before I saw the movie. The book made the movie a let diwn

This by far was my favorite book of alll time. I saw the  movie first and thought the book would be just like it. I was so wrong . Now that I have read the book I wonder where they got the movie from the  characters are more developed the dinosaurs are more real and the action glues you to your seat. I read it in 4 hours this is well worth the time and money

The book was better done than the movie, but isn't that always the way? The movie was a bit melodramatic, and I really enjoyed the details that were necessarily left out of the movie. If you enjoyed the movie, read the book. Very suspenseful, and as well written as we've come to expect from this author. Exactly the kind of thoughtful escapist reading I love.

It is a very good book and I recomend it to anyone and everyone. If you liked the movie then you'll like the book, even though the book is very different from the movie. WHile everyone was going "Ohhh" and  "Ahhh" over the dinosaurs, the reader will be going  "Ohhh" and "Ahhh" over the plot. It was fabulously  written.

This is a MUST read book!!!!! Once you start reading you can't stop.  If you liked the movie, you'll love the book even better.  This extrodinary novel is about the recovering of dinosaur DNA.  These extinct animals are being rediscovered after hundreds of years, and are roaming in Jurassic Park. Something goes wrong when they start breeding themselves...
Not the best MC book but better than the movie!

I have always been a huge fan of the movies and was obviously a little late getting to the book.  I was not disappointed by the book at all.  Crichton has a great way of building characters and suspense simultaneously without missing a beat.  It felt like a completely new story to me and I'm glad to be introduced to his work through this particular book.

This book was most likely the best I ever read. There was always something going on. Even when there was nothing but science talk, there was a important part of the plot hidden in there. This book was also real  suspensful at times. Sometimes it made me want to barf. I would recomend  this book to someone who's looking for a lot of action and adventure.

Michael Crichton does what so few science fiction authors have done in this day and age. By taking an age old scientific fact such as cloning, and combining it with a not too far off concept, then backing it up with  plausible research, believable characters and a riveting plot, Michael  Chrichton has created a masterpiece truly worthy of its genre.

Not the most suspenseful book I've read, but I did see the movie first (I read this for school and who hasn't already seen the movie?). It is a good book though and I would recommend it. It's a fun way to learn about dinosaurs for sure!
So much better than the movie! I plan to read more from this author! Great book, it was very entertaining

Jurassic park is a stroke of genius from Crichton. I had seen Spielberg 's movie version of Jurassic Park was amazing. I finally read the book though and found ten times better than the movie as books mainly are. This book was great at describing characters and was so tense at some parts I was scared myself. There was as well many surprises that I never suspected to happen. I also can't f or get the dinosaurs. There were a lot more species then showed in the movie. I would recommend this book to people who have read one of Crichton's books. As well for people who would enjoy this type of genre

I've read all Crichton's fiction books and some of his non-fiction, and this book and The Lost World are the best.  7th time through the book and I feel like it was just as good as the 1st time I fell in love with it.
Very good book. I look forward to the next one. Much better than the movie, fascinating scientific explanations. Makes me want to read more about chaos theory.
this is an exciting novel that also raises moral questions associated with genetic research and scientific research in general.  all while being wildly entertaining.
This was amazing all the way through! It ne'er got boring. It was pure amazing. That is all I have to say
I like the story it was very interesting a d kept you interested I think this was a very good book

From the first chapter the reader is captured into the adventure of this tale.  You become involved with the characters and the perils that their lives are placed in.  The momentum is such that I could not put it down until finished.  Great read

Anyone who is interested in reading one of Michael Crichton's novels for the first time, or just looking to re-discover an old story - look no further. Jurassic Park is an amazing book that will keep you turning pages from the moment you pick it up. Even fans of the movie will enjoy reading the original book.
Very good story don't care if I'm not helpful :) apparently there are ten more strategists so I like pancakes yay!

This book is, in my opinion much better than the movie. It is fun, fast-paced, and well written prose. The science, however is quite laughable now. I am a graduate student in molecular biology and it is hilarious to me how simply the author (and presumably his scientific sources) viewed life in the late 80s early 90s. It comes across as if the only thing that matters is DNA sequence and you can cut and paste and synthesize whatever you want and they can still get viable results. If only manipulating it was that easy. But still a very fun sci-fi read.
This is a really fun and fast-paced book. It's even better than the movie, and has several scenes that didn't make it into the movie to begin with.

As is usually the case, I thoroughly enjoyed the book more than the movie.  However, the movie is still one of my all-time faves & I will sit & watch it a thousand more times lol.  I have read the book 3 times so far & I am sure I'll re-read it over & over again :)
Loved this book. Absolutely amazing! It takes you to a whole different world, you feel like you are actually there.

I absolutely love the movie Jurassic Park, and for years have wanted to read the original novel by Michael Crichton.  An ingeniously crafted book, part science fiction, part thriller.  I was riveted to the story the whole way through!  The overall plot is the same as the movie, with many of the same characters, but there are also enough differences to make it new and fresh for those who have already seen the movie.  Mr. Crichton is a master of developing novels that translate so readily onto the large screen.  I can't wait to read more!  The world lost a wonderful writer when he passed.
This was a great book. The author described the characters really well. The movie left out very crucial detail but John Spielberg did a great job.

I grew up watching the movies and i am a big fan.  However, the book is so much better.  I was hesitant to read the book for fear that it would be similar to the movie and I would be bored but I was very wrong.  If you are hesitant for the same reason read it anyway.  I think most would enjoy it.
A great companion to the movie.  Fills in some of the blanks, and it's different in many places.  You can see where they made the cuts and refined the story for the movie.  A good story.
Great book. I loved reading it much better then the movie!!!! Deffently worth a reading a real page turner. R
Fantastic perception of bioengineering advances. Loved the story, so much better than the movie (of course) and frightening in the suspense of the unknown behavior if the animals.

This is a great book!  I saw the movie when I was a kid when I was 8, and I loved it.  Years later I escaped into Crichton's books starting in Junior High School.  Now I have read nearly everything he has written, and this is one of my favorites.  The JP 1 and 2 books are both fantastic, not perfect, but great still!  My favorite novels by Crichton are JP 1 & 2, Sphere, Airframe, and Prey.  The only books I didn't like were State of Fear, and Next, both of those are super preachy and don't have a compelling story in my opinion, more about Crichton stating his beliefs and less about a good read.  Pirate Latitudes and Micro that have been released after his death are both ok, but not great.  I think other authors had to finish both of those books.  I have also read and enjoyed some of his more obscure books.  Start with the popular ones and move in to the obscure ones, you won't be sorry!
Such a great book! Riveting and a unique experience. If you are familiar with the movie, then give the novel a chance. It adds a different spin on this classic.
Suspenseful, entertaining and creative. Great novel for any Sci Fi lover. No dinosaur fiction comes close to Jurassic Park. It's timeless.

It's been a couple of decades since I last read Michael Crichton's "Jurassic Park."  I remember that I liked the book way back then.  With this re-reading, I was very pleasantly surprised that the book surpassed my remembrance.  The book's world could very well be our world, the concept behind it is excellent, and the writing (plot, pacing, characters, language) are all excellent, too.  The only things I didn't like in the book were two of the characters:  Ian Malcolm and Liz (the young girl).  Crichton could have written the book without a whining, spoiled, self-centered child in it, so I have no idea why he included the girl.  And, why he insisted on writing Malcolm so that all he does is spout generalities about how he predicted failure but never gets around to explaining in what manner, I don't know.  I just found both of those characters irritating.  But, even so, that barely detracts from the book.  I rate it at an Excellent 5 stars out of 5.

After seeing the movie recently, I re-read the novel.  There is really no comparison.  The novel is a more complex story, with an entire sub-story that is missing from the movie.  Also, there are a couple more principal characters.  And the characters are better developed in the novel, as well as having different attributes  (e.g., in the movie, Dr. Grant hates kids;  in the novel, he loves them, etc.).  There is a lot of science presented in the novel.  Readers who are experts in the scientific disciplines discussed will have to occasionally suspend belief, but Mr. Crichton makes that easy.  And of course, the technology is dated.  But again, it is easy to just put yourself back into the 80's where the story is set.  Oh, and I'm now in the middle of the "Lost World" sequel novel, which in my opinion is even better than Jurassic Park.  Read them both in sequence.
and I was very pleased to finally see it formatted for the Kindle.  This was one of the first "adult" novels I read as a kid and my first Chrichton novel.

Because it is just different enough to warrant the time (for one thing there are actually villains in the novel !). And, since it's an adventure novel, the "prose" of Michael Crichton being very effective and dynamic, it doesn't take that much time anyway. It is fun to read and one cannot help but wonder how the scenes, that were NOT included in the movie, would have turned out. All in all, a good entertaining moment.
Great book to get into.  Although I saw the movie numerous times the book blows it out of the water.  There are complete aspects of the book the movie left out
Although everyone is familiar with the movie, nothing beats the book which has a much more realistic and darker ending than the movie.

Before I ever read this novel, I was a huge fan all three jurassic park movies, especially the first one. But you HAVE to read the original novel to really captivate the suspense and science of the situations. The way Micheal writes by making seem like it is all happening right before you is genius! While you are reading, somewhere in the back of the author's mind, you feel like he believes that it can all happen. He is so intelligent, and he is the best writer to walk the face of the earth.
Get ready for a wild ride!  If you like dinosaurs, you'll love this book.  It's also a little scary in that we have the technology to do this.

The Spielberg movie was fun, but it doesn't begin to compare to Crichton's book in complexity, wonder, pacing, intelligence, character development, and (above all) suspense. This is simply one of the greatest thrillers I've  ever read, dinosaurs or no dinosaurs. Crichton keeps ratcheting up the  tension, far beyond what you would expect was possible. This has to be his  finest book. There's a little bit of the misogyny that all but ruins  "Disclosure" and "Sphere" for me, and some of the same  corporate infighting that tried my patience in "Rising Sun" and  his new time travel book, among others. The young girl character is this  book has to be one of the most annoyingly sexist creations of the late  twentieth century. Thank God they gave her character a rewrite before they  filmed it; I was seriously afraid they would cast Mary Kate and Ashley  Olson in the part, and I would have had to get up and walk out of the  theater or else risk my brain exploding. But for once the flaws and  eccentricities are completely submerged behind the flawless, brilliant  execution of an astoundingly original and exciting concept. The author  loves to preach about the perils of technology and the limitations of human  cleverness, and genetic engineering, I have to say, provides him with a  topic that fully warrants his skeptical attitude. If you only know  "Jurassic Park" from the movie, you have no IDEA how much better  and scarier the book will be. Brace yourself for the vicious juvenile t-rex  and the ferocious pterosaurs (both scandalously missing from the big screen  version) and don't say I didn't warn you.

Michael Crichton is undeniably an addictive author, but in all honesty, this book lacked some important factors.  Clever though Ian Malcolm may be, he rarely predicts anything the reader hadn't predicted three pages beforehand, and several of the supporting characters are intolerably wooden.  From a palaeontological perspective, the book is a loss.  That Spielberg based his film upon Crichton's template was insult upon injury.  Velociraptor mongoliensis was merely fifty centimetres tall, and Dilophosaurus wetherilli, devoid of hollow teeth, spat no poisons.  I could almost forgive his factual errors had he not brandished them all over the sequel, The Lost World.  I'm left to wonder what errors existed in other novels, on other scientific topics.  All in all, I think Jurassic Park is worth a look--just don't believe everything you read.  --Darren Jame

I saw the movie in the 90's, but only now got around to reading the novel because several people have told me how great it is. I was sorely disappointed. The entire first half of the book is fairly boring. I literally had to force myself to keep reading. The platitudes about science going too far and not having the ability to determine IF something SHOULD be done are very preachy and off-putting, and I'm generally receptive to those types of arguments. The symmetry between the dinosaurs' inability to see movement and the high-tech equipment's similar inability is a nice touch; nevertheless,this novel would not gain such notoriety if published today because the science/mathematics/computer parts are no longer new/correct. The characters are mostly cardboard cutouts (the computer geek's name is actually a mild rearrangement of the word "nerdy"). The research that Crichton did to prepare for this novel is impressive, but the telling of the story leaves a lot to be desired. It's a great premise, and the ideas put forth about dinosaurs were cutting-edge at the time. But the execution is lacking.

Jurassic Park by Michael Crichton takes science fiction to the next level.  Michael Crichton proves his brilliance by creating a whole new world of dinosaurs, in a way that may seem possible in the distant future.  He creates the dinosaurs by taking DNA out of ancient mosquitoes that are trapped in amber from the dinosaur time period.  It's amazing how much time, thought, and research it had to take him to create his brilliant world.  Most people watch the movie, and just expect the book to be just the same.  But that is not correct.  The novel has many more differences than the movie. For example, the novel has a totally different ending than the first movie.  In fact, the ending of the first Jurassic Park novel is used in the second Jurassic Park movie when they discover the birdcage and travel through it in the midst of the pterodactyls.  If you have not read the book, and enjoyed the movie, I would recommend reading this novel.  Some think this novel is kind of childish, and I can see why they think that because of the dinosaurs, but I must say I really enjoyed it. It opens up the imagination, and makes you really wonder if re-creating dinosaurs would really be possible.  So if ever you are looking for a good novel to read, check out Jurassic Park.

Jurassic Park is an excellent science fiction novel.  Although many people  already know about the movie, the original book has more events, settings,  and people.  This book is true to Michael Chrichton's writing syle:  strong and somewhat gory.  One part that I have always liked, although it  is not in the movie, is the beggining,  A small girl is vacationing with  her family, and goes out looking for birds.  She finds a strange 3-toed,  1-foot-tall lizard that wals upright on two feet and begins playing with  it.  The lizard is friendly for several minutes until it becomes vicious  and attacks her.  As it turns out, the the lizard is really a dinosaur  which excaped from a neighboring island, Jurassic PArk.  The rest of  the book's plot line is similar to that of the movie, but has a few  differant details and many events that didn't appear in the film, such as a  surpirse ending.  I would suggest this book to any mature reader who  wouldn't mind a bit of gore.

Jurassic Park is scientifically engaging (I learnt quite a bit about dinosaurs and cloning), exciting, and scary enough to give you nightmares. It was generally a satisfying book. The characters were well developed, it controlled your emotions with an iron fist, but most of all, the basic plot is astoundingly good. I do however have numerous complaints. The mystery wears off much to suddenly after the visitors arrive at Jurassic Park - they become way to casual about what they are seeing (I wanted to them to be more dumbfounded). Emotions are too rarely described. Hammond is such a weirdo - how could somebody like him end up running such an enormous project. The extreme and continuous action is at times tiresome, and the ending is quite unsatisfactory (extremely unconclusive). Also, although that Malcolm guy is himself pretty cool, that chaos theory and how he calculated how the park would fall into dismay gives me a real headache.

In 1989 Isla Nubar (an island off the coast of Costa Rica) was purchased to house dinosaurs in an attraction park which sounds like a good idea to me.  This conclusion is determined with some over sight though.  What if there was catastrophic system failure?  What if some of the dinosaurs were extremely dangerous and much smarter than expected?  These problems are adressed in Jurassic Park a technical in depth look at what an incredibly wealthy man who loves dinosaurs would do in order to bring them back to life.  Of course bringing extinct creatures back to life would never work which is proven in Jurassic Park.  The systems fail causing the dinosaurs to get free and attack the trial visitors.  Eventually a helicopter from the Costa Rican National Guard rescues the survivors.  This story is written with great detail and is one of the best books I have every read.

I also think that the characters make really dumb decisions; a prime example is late in the book, when Grant and the rest escape from the visitor's center and a helicopter is on it's way, they decide to 'check out' the raptor breeding grounds.  Can't they wait an hour?  Have they not put their lives on the line enough??  Surveying a nest of deadly predators that have been trying to kill me for the last twelve chapters would be the LAST thing I do!  If you want excitement, watch Jurassic Park the movie.  Or if you prefer reading, Lost World, which is the Jurassic Park sequel, is much better.
